title: I feel absolutely broken now... When my team decides to surrender AFTER I last hit the enemy nexus.

It's because it costed a first win of the day and all of the effort they put in was worthless because of 4 assholes who surrendered just to do it.

If you worked your hardest on a 20 page essay for a class competition, but lost because someone wrote 4 words and the teacher liked it more, wouldn't you feel like you were cheated out?

And you know what's sad? Most 4-man premades will make that troll 4-man premade look like decent fellows.

People should be automatically kicked from the client and then struck by lightning if they try to queue up for a game in a 4-man premade.

Because every 4-man is a total troll? That's really not okay. Sometimes I like to get with my friends and have fun. 5-man premades don't always work out when all of you work different schedules. If we're doing something wonky and there's a random we let them know what's up before things start, so they can decide if they want in.

Sometimes people suck, but you can't punish everyone who is actually just being good and having fun for it.

Oh my dear sweet summer child.

Have you ever learned about the "negativity bias"?
I'll proceed to explain, say girl A slaps you, but then girl A comforts you, regardless of the order of these actions, the negative one, is much more likely to influence you in a stronger way.

How many times do you think you teammated with 4 man premades and you didn't even notice?
How many times do you really think they were a decent group of lads/ladettes?

Stop this bullshit of spreading around "omg premades are toxic". Me and my pals, have taken a standing to never revealing we are premades, for just that seems to warrant reports nowadays. People, everyone, is toxic. Toxicity is defined by the effect you have on the enemy player. I once severelly offended an enemy Thresh by telling him to "stfu and play". This, was toxic to him, while to me, the countless "get cancer %%%got" aren't toxic at all, it's just people... albeit primitively venting out anger.

Just because YOUR friends are nice doesn't make the rest of the 4-man premades nice. Of course all your 4-man premades are going to seem great WHEN YOU'RE THE ONE IN THE 4-MAN PREMADE.

I used to play normals back when lolnexus would tell you who was premade, and I'll tell you exactly how this works out for SOLO QUEUERS. 

The nice people premade with other nice people and douchebags premade with other douchebags. As a solo queuer, when you get stuck in a game with a 4-man premade, you have a 50% chance of getting a bunch of friendly guys who may or may not even talk to you due to skype, and you have another 50% chance of getting douchebags that are going to make you _never want to play league again_.

I have not touched normal game solo queue in **YEARS** because of consistent 4-man premade trolling that I was unable to deal with anymore. Dozens of my worst experiences in league were all thanks to 4-man premades ganging up to make my life hell. Ranked doesn't even come _close_ to the bullshit you have to deal with when you're matched with a 4-man premade of douchebags.

Meh.

I mean, my friends and I will actually do this when we stomp the enemy team really hard.
Mainly, _**it's not about the outcome, but about everything along the way.**_
Sure, we KNOW we won, but it's just hella funny to see the enemy team be completely bewildered when they see our nexus explode after their's, and then they get the VICTORY screen.

And it makes it fun for both teams. We get to laugh our asses off about how the enemy team reacts about the outcome, the enemy team is in a good mood from our sportsmanship in giving up the VICTORY screen. And then we ironically shit talk like "GGEZ" or "NICE VICTORY SCREEN GUISE" and stuff like that; funny, cuz it's coming from us, the team who technically LOST.

Either way, be a good sport man. The end outcome isn't what really matters. If you won, then you won, and that's what matters. And if your team troll surrenders at the end of the game, have a laugh with them about it.

I am inclined to disagree. It _**IS**_ about the outcome as the game sees it. I don't gain nearly as much IP or Champ Mastery for a loss than I do for a win. In the game, it's another loss in a streak. it's another game that doesn't give me a First Win of the Day.

But what pissed me off most of all, is that they did this completely without my knowledge or consent. Playing a game for 35 minutes only for the rest of your team to just surprise me with a surrender right when I scored us the victory.

They blatantly trolled me and wasted my time. Even if I consider this a win, the game doesn't. And the game is what matters to me.

Honestly, 99% of the time when myself and 3 friends do this, it is not to troll our teammate. It is to mess with the enemy team and to help the LOSING ENEMY TEAM with a good attitude and show of funny sportsmanship. 

The only time we'd do this to **spite** the other teammate we have, is if they are toxic and flaming all throughout the game. 

I can sympathize with not getting as much IP or Champion Mastery. 

As far as humor goes, to each their own. If you are THAT worried about what the endgame screen says (regardless of what actually transpired in game) for a normal game, then perhaps reconsider the reasons why you are playing this game. 

The fun is in the journey, not the destination.

So we carried him, then surrendered. He didn't deserve a win. Not saying you deserved it, was just throwing my random story out there.

I always try to surrender when I know my team is going to win.

Because I know it means the enemy team had a bad game.

And giving them the victory helps them deal with frustrating games.

League isn't about winning, it's about having fun. And when you carry 13/1/17 with support Poppy, you know the enemy team isn't having fun.

If League isn't about winning, then why does it matter if the enemy wins or loses?
I've been on the receiving end of this, and let me tell you, it's probably the most patronizing shit I've seen in this game. I totally agree that this game isn't about winning all the time. You have to find your own purpose in this game.

What you're doing is, "oh, I'm sorry that you've lost. But don't worry, here's a win anyway so your feewings don't get huwrt."

If you want to help bring someone up after what you think is a demoralizing, crushing loss, how about actually making a friendship with them and adding them on your friendlist after the game? Today we fight, tomorrow we fight together.

You might learn that they don't give two shits that support poppy was 13/1/17 and they were having fun all the same.
